sentences.english: CHILLY】You will feel chilly if you don't wear a coat on a cold day.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在冷天不穿上外套，將會感覺冷。

sentences.english: I hate this cursed cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭這種該死的冷天。

sentences.english: Is cold sky of light prologues, that mild eye Jing but all over undressed.
sentences.chinese: 冷天淡淡開口，那雙平淡的眼精時而冒出精光。

sentences.english: Ice pops are good on hot days but may not be good on a cold day.
sentences.chinese: 冰棍熱天很棒，但冷天就可能不那麼好了。

sentences.english: Go for a walk in the mall on cold days.
I can’t evaluate the sweaters yet because the cold weather hasn’t arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我沒法預估有多少毛衣，因爲冷天還沒到。

sentences.english: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
sentences.chinese: 對傷心的人唱歌，就如冷天脫衣服，又如鹼上倒醋。

sentences.english: You should wrap up your neck in this cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的冷天裏，你應把脖子圍起來。

sentences.english: he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, [and as] vinegar upon nitre, so [is] he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
sentences.chinese: 對傷心的人唱歌，就如冷天脫衣服，又如鹼上倒醋。

sentences.english: Don't let hot or cold weather give you an excuse not to run.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓熱天或冷天成爲你不跑步的藉口。

sentences.english: My skin soon chapped in cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 我的皮膚在冷天裏很快就皸裂了。

sentences.english: Her arthritis kicks up in cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 她的關節炎每到冷天就發作。

sentences.english: If his home is better, who would put stall in the cold night.
sentences.chinese: 家境哪怕好一點，誰會大冷天夜裏擺地攤。

definition: cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
to blow cold/damping expectations by discouraging or realistic words
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
bare upper body/bare-chested/to bare one's chest
a world of ice and snow
